poem:
"Dark Corners of Westminster"

Wheels of politics turn, heavy with deceit,
Suspensions swing like chandeliers in echo halls.
Benton, stung, faces the squall of defeat,
While in the shadows, Sunak appalls.

Through the lobby, promises crawl -
A by-election brews in the pending fall.
A dance of penance, power's bitter recall,
Democracy hums her unsparing ballad to all.
